an1.575:0.2.eng: The Chapter on Mindfulness of the Body

an1.575:1.1.pli: “Yassa kassaci, bhikkhave, mahāsamuddo cetasā phuṭo antogadhā tassa kunnadiyo yā kāci samuddaṅgamā;
an1.575:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, anyone who brings into their mind the great ocean includes all of the streams that run into it.

an1.575:1.2.pli: evamevaṃ, bhikkhave, yassa kassaci kāyagatā sati bhāvitā bahulīkatā antogadhā tassa kusalā dhammā ye keci vijjābhāgiyā”ti.
an1.575:1.2.eng: In the same way, anyone who has developed and cultivated mindfulness of the body includes all of the skillful qualities that play a part in realization.”

an1.576-582:1.1.pli: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato mahato saṃvegāya saṃvattati … mahato atthāya saṃvattati … mahato yogakkhemāya saṃvattati … satisampajaññāya saṃvattati … ñāṇadassanappaṭilābhāya saṃvattati … diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāya saṃvattati … vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati.
an1.576-582:1.1.eng: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated leads to great urgency … great benefit … great sanctuary from the yoke … mindfulness and awareness … gaining knowledge and vision … blissful meditation in this life … the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom.

an1.576-582:1.4.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato mahato saṃvegāya saṃvattati … mahato atthāya saṃvattati … mahato yogakkhemāya saṃvattati … satisampajaññāya saṃvattati … ñāṇadassanappaṭilābhāya saṃvattati … diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāya saṃvattati … vijjāvimuttiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattatī”ti.
an1.576-582:1.4.eng: This one thing, when developed and cultivated, leads to great urgency … great benefit … great sanctuary from the yoke … mindfulness and awareness … gaining knowledge and vision … blissful meditation in this life … the realization of the fruit of knowledge and freedom.”

an1.583:1.1.pli: “Ekadhamme, bhikkhave, bhāvite bahulīkate kāyopi passambhati, cittampi passambhati, vitakkavicārāpi vūpasammanti, kevalāpi vijjābhāgiyā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti.
an1.583:1.1.eng: “When one thing, mendicants, is developed and cultivated the body and mind become tranquil, thinking and considering settle down, and all of the qualities that play a part in realization are fully developed.

an1.583:1.4.pli: Imasmiṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhamme bhāvite bahulīkate kāyopi passambhati, cittampi passambhati, vitakkavicārāpi vūpasammanti, kevalāpi vijjābhāgiyā dhammā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchantī”ti.
an1.583:1.4.eng: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, the body and mind become tranquil, thinking and considering settle down, and all of the qualities that play a part in realization are fully developed.”

an1.584:1.1.pli: “Ekadhamme, bhikkhave, bhāvite bahulīkate anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā nuppajjanti, uppannā ca akusalā dhammā pahīyanti.
an1.584:1.1.eng: “When one thing, mendicants, is developed and cultivated, unskillful qualities do not arise, and, if they’ve already arisen, they are given up.

an1.584:1.4.pli: Imasmiṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhamme bhāvite bahulīkate anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā nuppajjanti, uppannā ca akusalā dhammā pahīyantī”ti.
an1.584:1.4.eng: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, unskillful qualities do not arise, and, if they’ve already arisen, they are given up.”

an1.585:1.1.pli: “Ekadhamme, bhikkhave, bhāvite bahulīkate anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti, uppannā ca kusalā dhammā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattanti.
an1.585:1.1.eng: “When one thing, mendicants, is developed and cultivated, skillful qualities arise, and, once they’ve arisen, they increase and grow.

an1.585:1.4.pli: Imasmiṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhamme bhāvite bahulīkate anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti, uppannā ca kusalā dhammā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattantī”ti.
an1.585:1.4.eng: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, skillful qualities arise, and, once they’ve arisen, they increase and grow.”

an1.586-590:1.1.pli: “Ekadhamme, bhikkhave, bhāvite bahulīkate avijjā pahīyati … vijjā uppajjati … asmimāno pahīyati … anusayā samugghātaṃ gacchanti … saṃyojanā pahīyanti.
an1.586-590:1.1.eng: “When one thing, mendicants, is developed and cultivated, ignorance is given up … knowledge arises … the conceit ‘I am’ is given up … the underlying tendencies are uprooted … the fetters are given up.

an1.586-590:1.4.pli: Imasmiṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhamme bhāvite bahulīkate avijjā pahīyati … vijjā uppajjati … asmimāno pahīyati … anusayā samugghātaṃ gacchanti … saṃyojanā pahīyantī”ti.
an1.586-590:1.4.eng: When this one thing is developed and cultivated, ignorance is given up … knowledge arises … the conceit ‘I am’ is given up … the underlying tendencies are uprooted … the fetters are given up.”

an1.591-592:1.1.pli: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato paññāpabhedāya saṃvattati … anupādāparinibbānāya saṃvattati.
an1.591-592:1.1.eng: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated leads to demolition by wisdom … to complete extinguishment with no fuel for grasping.

an1.591-592:1.4.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato paññāpabhedāya saṃvattati … anupādāparinibbānāya saṃvattatī”ti.
an1.591-592:1.4.eng: This one thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated leads to demolition by wisdom … to complete extinguishment with no fuel for grasping.”

an1.593-595:1.1.pli: “Ekadhamme, bhikkhave, bhāvite bahulīkate anekadhātupaṭivedho hoti … nānādhātupaṭivedho hoti … anekadhātupaṭisambhidā hoti.
an1.593-595:1.1.eng: “When one thing is developed and cultivated there is the penetration of many elements … the penetration of diverse elements … the analysis of many elements.

an1.593-595:1.4.pli: Imasmiṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhamme bhāvite bahulīkate anekadhātupaṭivedho hoti … nānādhātupaṭivedho hoti … anekadhātupaṭisambhidā hotī”ti.
an1.593-595:1.4.eng: When this one thing is developed and cultivated there is the penetration of many elements … the penetration of diverse elements … the analysis of many elements.”

an1.596-599:1.1.pli: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati … sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati … anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati … arahattaphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati.
an1.596-599:1.1.eng: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated leads to the realization of the fruit of stream-entry … once-return … non-return … perfection.

an1.596-599:1.4.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati … sakadāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati … anāgāmiphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattati … arahattaphalasacchikiriyāya saṃvattatī”ti.
an1.596-599:1.4.eng: This one thing, when developed and cultivated, leads to the realization of the fruit of stream-entry … once-return … non-return … perfection.”

an1.600-615:1.1.pli: “Ekadhammo, bhikkhave, bhāvito bahulīkato paññāpaṭilābhāya saṃvattati … paññāvuddhiyā saṃvattati … paññāvepullāya saṃvattati … mahāpaññatāya saṃvattati … puthupaññatāya saṃvattati … vipulapaññatāya saṃvattati … gambhīrapaññatāya saṃvattati … asāmantapaññatāya saṃvattati … bhūripaññatāya saṃvattati … paññābāhullāya saṃvattati … sīghapaññatāya saṃvattati … lahupaññatāya saṃvattati … hāsapaññatāya saṃvattati … javanapaññatāya saṃvattati … tikkhapaññatāya saṃvattati … nibbedhikapaññatāya saṃvattati.
an1.600-615:1.1.eng: “One thing, mendicants, when developed and cultivated, leads to the getting of wisdom … the growth of wisdom … the increase of wisdom … to great wisdom … to widespread wisdom … to abundant wisdom … to deep wisdom … to extraordinary wisdom … to vast wisdom … to much wisdom … to fast wisdom … to light wisdom … to laughing wisdom … to swift wisdom … to sharp wisdom … to penetrating wisdom.

an1.600-615:1.4.pli: Ayaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ekadhammo bhāvito bahulīkato paññāpaṭilābhāya saṃvattati … paññāvuddhiyā saṃvattati … paññāvepullāya saṃvattati … mahāpaññatāya saṃvattati … puthupaññatāya saṃvattati … vipulapaññatāya saṃvattati … gambhīrapaññatāya saṃvattati … asāmantapaññatāya saṃvattati … bhūripaññatāya saṃvattati … paññābāhullāya saṃvattati … sīghapaññatāya saṃvattati … lahupaññatāya saṃvattati … hāsapaññatāya saṃvattati … javanapaññatāya saṃvattati … tikkhapaññatāya saṃvattati … nibbedhikapaññatāya saṃvattatī”ti.
an1.600-615:1.4.eng: This one thing, when developed and cultivated, leads to the getting of wisdom … the growth of wisdom … the increase of wisdom … to great wisdom … to widespread wisdom … to abundant wisdom … to deep wisdom … to extraordinary wisdom … to vast wisdom … to much wisdom … to fast wisdom … to light wisdom … to laughing wisdom … to swift wisdom … to sharp wisdom … to penetrating wisdom.”

an1.61:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā akusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, vīriyārambho.
an1.61:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like arousing energy.

an1.61:1.2.pli: Āraddhavīriyassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca akusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
an1.61:1.2.eng: When you’re energetic, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”

an1.62:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā kusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, mahicchatā.
an1.62:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like having many wishes.

an1.62:1.2.pli: Mahicchassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca kusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
an1.62:1.2.eng: When you have many wishes, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”

an1.63:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā akusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, appicchatā.
an1.63:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like having few wishes.

an1.63:1.2.pli: Appicchassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca akusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
an1.63:1.2.eng: When you have few wishes, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”

an1.64:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā kusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, asantuṭṭhitā.
an1.64:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like lack of contentment.

an1.64:1.2.pli: Asantuṭṭhassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca kusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
an1.64:1.2.eng: When you lack contentment, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”

an1.65:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā akusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, santuṭṭhitā.
an1.65:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like contentment.

an1.65:1.2.pli: Santuṭṭhassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca akusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
an1.65:1.2.eng: When you’re contented, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”

an1.66:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā kusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, ayonisomanasikāro.
an1.66:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like irrational application of mind.

an1.66:1.2.pli: Ayoniso, bhikkhave, manasi karoto anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca kusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
an1.66:1.2.eng: When you apply the mind irrationally, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”

an1.67:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā akusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, yonisomanasikāro.
an1.67:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like rational application of mind.

an1.67:1.2.pli: Yoniso, bhikkhave, manasi karoto anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca akusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
an1.67:1.2.eng: When you apply the mind rationally, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”

an1.68:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā kusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, asampajaññaṃ.
an1.68:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like lack of situational awareness.

an1.68:1.2.pli: Asampajānassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca kusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
an1.68:1.2.eng: When you lack situational awareness, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”

an1.69:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā akusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, sampajaññaṃ.
an1.69:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like situational awareness.

an1.69:1.2.pli: Sampajānassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca akusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
an1.69:1.2.eng: When you have situational awareness, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”

an1.70:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā kusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, pāpamittatā.
an1.70:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like bad friends.

an1.70:1.2.pli: Pāpamittassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca kusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
an1.70:1.2.eng: When you have bad friends, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”

an1.616:0.2.eng: The Chapter on Freedom From Death

an1.616:1.1.pli: “Amataṃ te, bhikkhave, na paribhuñjanti ye kāyagatāsatiṃ na paribhuñjanti.
an1.616:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, those who don’t enjoy mindfulness of the body don’t enjoy freedom from death.

an1.616:1.2.pli: Amataṃ te, bhikkhave, paribhuñjanti ye kāyagatāsatiṃ paribhuñjantī”ti.
an1.616:1.2.eng: Those who enjoy mindfulness of the body enjoy freedom from death.”

an1.617:1.1.pli: “Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, aparibhuttaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati aparibhuttā.
an1.617:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, those who haven’t enjoyed mindfulness of the body haven’t enjoyed freedom from death.

an1.617:1.2.pli: Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, paribhuttaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati paribhuttā”ti.
an1.617:1.2.eng: Those who have enjoyed mindfulness of the body have enjoyed freedom from death.”

an1.618:1.1.pli: “Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, parihīnaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati parihīnā.
an1.618:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, those who have lost mindfulness of the body have lost freedom from death.

an1.618:1.2.pli: Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, aparihīnaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati aparihīnā”ti.
an1.618:1.2.eng: Those who haven’t lost mindfulness of the body haven’t lost freedom from death.”

an1.619:1.1.pli: “Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, viraddhaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati viraddhā.
an1.619:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, those who have missed out on mindfulness of the body have missed out on freedom from death.

an1.619:1.2.pli: Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, āraddhaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati āraddhā”ti.
an1.619:1.2.eng: Those who have undertaken mindfulness of the body have not missed out on freedom from death.”

an1.620:1.1.pli: “Amataṃ te, bhikkhave, pamādiṃsu ye kāyagatāsatiṃ pamādiṃsu.
an1.620:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, those who have neglected mindfulness of the body have neglected freedom from death.

an1.620:1.2.pli: Amataṃ te, bhikkhave, na pamādiṃsu ye kāyagatāsatiṃ na pamādiṃsu”.
an1.620:1.2.eng: Those who have not neglected mindfulness of the body have not neglected freedom from death.”

an1.621:1.1.pli: “Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, pamuṭṭhaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati pamuṭṭhā.
an1.621:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, those who have forgotten mindfulness of the body have forgotten freedom from death.

an1.621:1.2.pli: Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, appamuṭṭhaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati appamuṭṭhā”ti.
an1.621:1.2.eng: Those who haven’t forgotten mindfulness of the body haven’t forgotten freedom from death.”

an1.622:1.1.pli: “Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, anāsevitaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati anāsevitā.
an1.622:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, those who haven’t cultivated mindfulness of the body haven’t cultivated freedom from death.

an1.622:1.2.pli: Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, āsevitaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati āsevitā”ti.
an1.622:1.2.eng: Those who have cultivated mindfulness of the body have cultivated freedom from death.”

an1.623:1.1.pli: “Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, abhāvitaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati abhāvitā.
an1.623:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, those who haven’t developed mindfulness of the body haven’t developed freedom from death.

an1.623:1.2.pli: Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvitaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati bhāvitā”ti.
an1.623:1.2.eng: Those who have developed mindfulness of the body have developed freedom from death.”

an1.624:1.1.pli: “Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, abahulīkataṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati abahulīkatā.
an1.624:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, those who haven’t made much of mindfulness of the body haven’t made much of the deathless.

an1.624:1.2.pli: Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, bahulīkataṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati bahulīkatā”ti.
an1.624:1.2.eng: Those who have made much of mindfulness of the body have made much of the deathless.”

an1.625:1.1.pli: “Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, anabhiññātaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati anabhiññātā.
an1.625:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, those who haven’t had insight into mindfulness of the body haven’t had insight into freedom from death.

an1.625:1.2.pli: Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, abhiññātaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati abhiññātā”ti.
an1.625:1.2.eng: Those who have had insight into mindfulness of the body have had insight into freedom from death.”

an1.626:1.1.pli: “Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, apariññātaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati apariññātā.
an1.626:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, those who haven’t completely understood mindfulness of the body haven’t completely understood freedom from death.

an1.626:1.2.pli: Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, pariññātaṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati pariññātā”ti.
an1.626:1.2.eng: Those who have completely understood mindfulness of the body have completely understood freedom from death.”

an1.627:1.1.pli: “Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, asacchikataṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati asacchikatā.
an1.627:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, those who haven’t realized mindfulness of the body haven’t realized freedom from death.

an1.627:1.2.pli: Amataṃ tesaṃ, bhikkhave, sacchikataṃ yesaṃ kāyagatāsati sacchikatā”ti.
an1.627:1.2.eng: Those who have realized mindfulness of the body have realized freedom from death.”

an1.627:1.3.eng: The thousand discourses of the Ones are completed.

an1.627:2.1.eng: That is what the Buddha said.

an1.627:2.2.pli: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandunti.
an1.627:2.2.eng: Satisfied, the mendicants approved what the Buddha said.

an1.627:2.4.eng: The Book of the Ones is finished.

an1.71:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā akusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, kalyāṇamittatā.
an1.71:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like good friends.

an1.71:1.2.pli: Kalyāṇamittassa, bhikkhave, anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca akusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
an1.71:1.2.eng: When you have good friends, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”

an1.72:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā kusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, anuyogo akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ, ananuyogo kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ.
an1.72:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like pursuing bad habits and not good habits.

an1.72:1.2.pli: Anuyogā, bhikkhave, akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ, ananuyogā kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ anuppannā ceva akusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca kusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
an1.72:1.2.eng: When you pursue bad habits and not good habits, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”

an1.73:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā vā akusalā dhammā parihāyanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, anuyogo kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ, ananuyogo akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ.
an1.73:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to skillful qualities, or makes unskillful qualities decline like pursuing good habits and not bad habits.

an1.73:1.2.pli: Anuyogā, bhikkhave, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ, ananuyogā akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ anuppannā ceva kusalā dhammā uppajjanti uppannā ca akusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti.
an1.73:1.2.eng: When you pursue good habits and not bad habits, skillful qualities arise and unskillful qualities decline.”

an1.74:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā bojjhaṅgā nuppajjanti uppannā vā bojjhaṅgā na bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, ayonisomanasikāro.
an1.74:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that prevents the awakening factors from arising, or, if they’ve already arisen, prevents them from being fully developed like irrational application of mind.

an1.74:1.2.pli: Ayoniso, bhikkhave, manasi karoto anuppannā ceva bojjhaṅgā nuppajjanti uppannā ca bojjhaṅgā na bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchantī”ti.
an1.74:1.2.eng: When you apply the mind irrationally, the awakening factors don’t arise, or, if they’ve already arisen, they’re not fully developed.”

an1.75:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi yena anuppannā vā bojjhaṅgā uppajjanti uppannā vā bojjhaṅgā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchanti yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, yonisomanasikāro.
an1.75:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to the awakening factors, or, if they’ve already arisen, fully develops them like rational application of mind.

an1.75:1.2.pli: Yoniso, bhikkhave, manasi karoto anuppannā ceva bojjhaṅgā uppajjanti uppannā ca bojjhaṅgā bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchantī”ti.
an1.75:1.2.eng: When you apply the mind rationally, the awakening factors arise, or, if they’ve already arisen, they’re fully developed.”

an1.76:1.1.eng: “Loss of relatives, mendicants, is a small thing.

an1.76:1.2.pli: Etaṃ patikiṭṭhaṃ, bhikkhave, parihānīnaṃ yadidaṃ paññāparihānī”ti.
an1.76:1.2.eng: Wisdom is the worst thing to lose.”

an1.77:1.1.eng: “Growth of relatives, mendicants, is a small thing.
